intro: Eleogiton parvula, commonly known as the small eleogiton, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eleogiton parvula is considered a conservation concern.
